extension.searchTitle: EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF THE HOUSE WITH RESPECT TO UNITED STATES POLICY TOWARDS YEMEN; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 185

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives with respect to United States policy towards Yemen
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives with respect to United States policy towards Yemen
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 599, expressing the sense of the House of Representatives with respect to United States policy towards Yemen, by a yea-and-nay vote of 366 yeas to 30 nays with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 623.

The House agreed to H. Res. 599, expressing the sense of the House of Representatives with respect to United States policy towards Yemen, by a yea-and-nay vote of 366 yeas to 30 nays with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 623.

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 3071, amended, to require executive agencies to consider equipment rental in any cost-effectiveness analysis for equipment acquisition, by a yea-and-nay vote of 396 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 624; and

extension.searchTitle: THE JOURNAL; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 185

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the Speaker's approval of the Journal by a yea-and-nay vote of 220 yeas to 165 nays with two answering ``present'', Roll No. 625.
